title: Consultant - Service Operations
job_function: Administrative, Customer Service, and Project Management
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will be based in one of our European offices as part of our Operations Practice.
   

  

 Our Operations Practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients’ most pressing problems.
   

  

 McKinsey’s Service Operations service line is part of our Operations Practice. It helps clients create and execute service strategies that lead to competitive advantage, an improved customer experience, higher effectiveness and quality of work, and measurable bottom-line impact.
   

  

 The service areas we work in range from end-customer services (e.g., call centers and field services) to internal back-office operations (e.g., in IT, HR, and Finance). In each of these areas, we help our clients enhance their productivity and set them up for the future, which, in many cases, leads to the longer-term transformation of the operating model (including structures, processes, technology, and people).
   

  

 When you join McKinsey as a Consultant, you join a firm that will challenge you and invest heavily in your professional development. You will have the opportunity to work in dynamic teams and help leading global organizations solve some of their most challenging and complex problems.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 You will play an active role in problem-solving for clients, including identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analyses, and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.
   

  

 You will shape clients’ digital agendas and lead them toward next-generation operational models—digitally transforming end-to-end journeys using advanced analytics, intelligent automation, GenAI, and agile methodologies in service-oriented industries. Additionally, you will assist our client teams in developing strategies and technology roadmaps for implementing processes and operating systems that support applications connected to digital service operations.
   

  

 As part of your role, you will help clients imagine and implement the future of service delivery—where AI, GenAI, and agentic technologies are reshaping how services are designed, delivered, and scaled.
   

  

 You will work with cross-functional teams to explore AI-native operating models, integrate intelligent agents into service ecosystems, and help client’s future-proof their service strategies by embedding emerging technologies across front- and back-office operations.
   

  

 While hands-on experience in these areas is a plus, what matters most is your ability to think ahead, connect technology to business outcomes, and inspire bold change.
   

  

 You will also gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training, frequent coaching, and ongoing mentoring from colleagues and senior leaders on your teams.
   

  

 As part of our two-year Operations Excellence Program (OEP), you will work on client engagements in the same way as any other McKinsey consultant. You will gain leading edge operations and consultancy skills, primarily through on-the-job coaching, which will be complemented by the OEP’s structured capability-building program.
   

  

 We view the OEP position as the start of a rewarding, challenging and highly flexible career with McKinsey and the Operations practice. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a junior practice specialist on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and operations service lines. You will acquire the necessary knowledge and expertise to help companies achieve excellence in their operations.
   

  

 Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate many days to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts. You will follow a curriculum based on operations excellence themes and will receive advanced training in one of six specific areas of operations manufacturing, product development, purchasing, service operations, supply chain management, or capital excellence.
   

  

 Upon completion of the program, successful consultants will join our global group of leading experts in operational excellence. We already have OEP graduates working at all levels of the firm from associate to partner.
   

  

*Your application should be in English and include your CV and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.), indicating all relevant grades.*
 OPS2024
   

  

**Your Qualifications and Skills**
* Master’s degree and exceptional academic performance
* Initial experience or strong interest in AI-powered service innovation, including digital solutions, robotics, and emerging technologies such as Generative AI, intelligent agents, and AI-native service models—ideally in banking, insurance, software, or consulting contexts
* Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
* Mobility and enthusiasm for taking on European assignments during the work week
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
* Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language

title: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
company_industry: Information Technology & Services, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description:
Role: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
 



  





 Location: Stockholm, Kista 16440
 



  





 Is it Permanent / Contract: open for both, preferably permanent.
 



  





 Rate: Best Reasonable market rate
 



  





 Is it Onsite/Remote/Hybrid: Onsite
 



  





  





  





 VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
 



  





 o Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
 



  





 o Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
 



  





 o Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
 



  





 o Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
 



  





 o Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
 



  





 o Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
 



  





 o Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
 



  





 o Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
 



  





 o Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
 



  





 o Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
 



  





 o Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
 



  





 o Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
 



  





 o Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
 



  





 o Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
 



  





 o Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
 



  





 o Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.
 



  





 Key Skills and Knowledge Areas
 



  





 · Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
 



  





 · Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
 



  





 · Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
 



  





 · Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
 



  





 · Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
 



  





 · Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.
 



  





 Tools and Technologies
 



  





 · VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
 



  





 · vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
 



  





 · NSX: For networking and security.
 



  





 · vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
 



  





 · Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code

title: Head of Operations
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 London or Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Direct global operations teams across multiple data centres and regions.
* Establish and optimize support infrastructure, SLAs, and escalation protocols.
* Develop metrics and KPIs to measure operational performance and customer satisfaction.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service reliability and efficiency.
* Manage large-scale incident response and problem resolution processes.
* Build and lead technical support teams across multiple tiers.
* Collaborate with engineering on product improvements based on operational insights.
* Establish standardized operating procedures and playbooks.
* Lead crisis management during major service disruptions.


**Skills We Value**
* 10+ years of experience in technical operations management, preferably in cloud services.
* Proven leadership experience managing large, distributed technical teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure, virtualization, and networking.
* Track record implementing automation and operational efficiency improvements.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with incident management and problem resolution at scale.
* Knowledge of compliance requirements for cloud services.
* MBA or technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Experience with data analytics and performance measurement systems.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Business Security Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
**About Northwave** 
 Defending the digital frontier is our mission.
   

  

 At Northwave, 275 cybersecurity specialists transform how organisations approach digital safety. From our HQ in Utrecht, along with offices in Germany, Sweden, and Belgium.
   

  

 Northwave combines ethical hacking expertise with behavioral psychology insights and cutting-edge security management at the highest level. We respond to threats and anticipate them, providing 24/7 managed security services and tailored solutions for each client's journey.
   

  

 By joining Northwave, you’ll become part of an organisation where innovation drives results, whether your talents lie in technical penetration testing or strategic client partnerships. Here, your expertise will grow and help shape the future of digital security across industries, leaving a lasting impact.
   

  

 What you do
   

  

 As a Business Security Consultant, you advise clients on the most suitable and cost-effective measures for security risks. You bridge the gap between security and the business of the organisation. In doing so, you make the client aware of their governance responsibility and provide insight into the current situation. You present your advice to the board of the organisation and lead to concrete decision-making and implementation of possible improvements. You are that strategic sparring partner to the client.
   

  

 The projects you work on are diverse and relate to topics such as security management (ISO 27001), risk management, compliance with standards and frameworks (NIST, DNB Good Practice) or cyber security legislation (NIS2, DORA), and of course Northwave’s total holistic approach to intelligent security operations. Your role can vary from conducting an assessment, managing and contributing to an implementation or an advisory role. Within these projects, we regularly collaborate with experts from other teams within Northwave.
   

  

 In addition to your advisory function to organisations, you also ensure that the client acts on the given advice. You play a crucial role in identifying potential consultancy opportunities for Northwave. Always from an ‘consultative selling mindset; where the added value for the client comes first. The clients you work with vary in size from medium-large to large international companies, in various sectors. They are mainly located in the Netherlands, but also some in Belgium, Germany or have various locations worldwide.
   

  

**The team**
 As a Business Security Consultant, you are part of the Risk Advisory team. As a team, we always strive for a high-quality but pragmatic approach, where the advice is implemented in a workable solution. We avoid long and bureaucratic documentation and focus on achieving the best and most pragmatic result possible. The team consists of 15+ Business Security Consultants, each with their own expertise. In addition, we work closely with the other teams within Northwave and always strive for an integrated approach. We have a strong ambition in the Risk Advisory domain, also internationally. This requires growth in expertise, seniority and further professionalisation of the team.
   

  

**You like to**
* Understand (complex) organisations and their business models in a short time
* Get to the core of an issue quickly
* Present to a board
* Help organisations to improve
* Work on multiple projects simultaneously
* Design a strategy and roadmap for the client’s cyber landscape
* Connect with clients and collaborate with colleagues from different departments


**What you can expect**
* Macbook, iPhone and lease car
* A market-based salary, depending on your knowledge and experience ranging between €5,000 and €8,000 per month.
* Company-wide courses and individual training opportunities to further develop yourself
* More than 250 passionate colleagues to work with and learn from
* Fun Northwave events and parties, look here on our work page for an overview


**Job Requirements**
* Several years (5+) of experience as a cyber security consultant, or in a similar role.
* Expertise in security management, risk management, relevant standards and legislation. But most importantly; we are looking for someone with a real passion for the profession. A ‘vakidioot’ as we call it within Northwave, with an ‘expert leadership’ influence on the team.
* An entrepreneurial mindset and no problem working independent.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* CISM/CISSP/CISA/CRISK/CIPM or related certifications are a plus, but not necessary.


**Interested?**
 What is important to you in your next step? We would love to hear from you and would like to talk to you. For more information, apply directly or contact Bastiaan.
   

  

 bastiaan.rolloos@northwave-cybersecurity.com
   

  

 +31 6 45 88 0490

title: Gruppträningsinstruktör till Gran Canaria
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 Ving har olika koncepthotell där du som gruppträningsinstruktör kan arbeta då vi erbjuder våra gäster professionell gruppträning och personlig träning i samarbete med SATS. Det finns något för alla, nybörjare till mer erfarna motionärer. Är du den vi söker?
   

  

 Vi söker nu en gruppträningsinstruktörer till vårt Sunprime hotell på Gran Canaria, nämligen Sunprime Atlantic View .
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att instruera core, vattengympa, yoga, crosstraining, tabata och power pilates. Våra gruppträningstjänster är alltid kombinerade och i denna tjänst arbetar som du i vår spa reception när du inte instruerar klasser. Är du dessutom personlig tränare finns det möjlighet att vara PT för våra gäster.
   

  

****Vem söker vi?****
 Vi förutsätter att du är en glädjespridare med en hög social kompetens. Du tycker om att arbeta i ett högt tempo och har erfarenhet av att leda grupper sedan tidigare. Utöver det har vi följande grundkrav:
   

  

****Grundkrav****
* Utbildad/licensierad gruppträningsinstruktör eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att instruera gruppträningsklasser
* Kan svenska el något av de nordiska språken flytande i både tal och skrift.
* Kan flytande engelska
* Har möjlighet att vara borta hela anställningsperioden från maj till november.


****Meriterande****
* Längre utlandsvistelser som t.ex. studier eller arbete
* Övriga språkkunskaper
* Är licencierad Personlig Tränare (grundkrav för vissa hotell)


 Som person är du utåtriktad, flexibel och serviceminded som trivs med att befinna dig i nya kulturer och miljöer. I din instruktörsroll är du professionell och känner en självsäkerhet när du instruerar klasser. Vidare är det viktigt att du tycker om att arbeta självtändigt och trivs i samarbete med lokala spanska kollegor.
   

  

 Vi vill att du ska utvecklas i din roll som gruppträningsinstruktör och arbeta flera säsonger där du ständigt utmanar dig själv och har en drivkraft att vilja prova på nya ansvarsområden. Det är därför viktigt för oss att du känner dig beredd att lämna vänner och familj hemma i Sverige för att kunna flytta utomlands under en längre tid.
   

  

****Övrigt****
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och vi ber dig därför att skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt.
   

  

**Startdatum:** 
 23 maj 2025
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 19 november
   

  

 För att vara aktuell för tjänsten behöver du kunna vara utomlands under hela perioden
   

  

**Arbetsort:** 
 Gran Canaria, Sunprime Atlantic View
   

  

**Anställningsform:** 
 Säsongsanställning.
   

  

 Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar på mail med hänsyn till GDPR.
   

  

 Om du är nyfiken på hur det är att arbeta utomlands för oss får du gärna följa oss via våra hashtags #workatsunwing #workatving #workatsunprime på Facebook och Instagram där .
   

  

 Vill du vara med på resan?
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! 🌟
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 Utomlands
   

  

 Roll: Fitnessinstruktör/PT
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm

title: IKT-ansvarig & Vaktmästare, Oxbacksenheten
description:
”Vi lär oss för livet, tillsammans lyckas vi!”
   

  

 Oxbacksenheten består av två kommunala skolor, Oxbacksskolan (F-3) och Mariekällskolan (4–9). Båda skolorna ligger centralt i Södertälje kommun och har högt söktryck. Idag har vi ca 800 elever och 85 anställda. Vi är en mångkulturell skola och arbetar ständigt med att utveckla och förbättra våra arbetssätt för att möta alla elevers behov.
   

  

 Lärande och trygghet står i fokus och vi på skolan arbetar regelbundet med resultat- och närvarouppföljning av alla elever. Vi har ett aktivt elevhälsoteam på skolan som stöttar såväl elever som personal i det dagliga arbetet. Skolans värdegrund vilar på en ansvarskultur där det är viktigt att alla är med och definierar behoven och tillsammans prioriterar efter de resurser som finns.
   

  

 Är du en lösningsorienterad person som både har ett intresse för IT och trivs med praktiskt arbete? Vi på Oxbacksenheten söker en engagerad och ansvarsfull medarbetare till en kombinerad tjänst som IKT-ansvarig och vaktmästare.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
**Tjänsten Är Fördelad På Två Huvudområden**
 IKT-ansvar (70%)
   

  

 Som IKT-ansvarig Kommer Du Att Ansvara För Skolans Tekniska Utrustning, Stödja Personal Och Elever Samt Hantera IT-administration. Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar
   

  

* IT-support till elever och personal, inklusive felsökning och reparation av iPads, datorer och mjukvara.
* Hantering av skolans nätverk, skrivare, projektorer och annan IT-utrustning – felsöka, felanmäla och följa upp ärenden.
* Vara kontaktperson gentemot kommunens IT-grupp, hålla dig uppdaterad om riktlinjer och nyheter.
* Ansvara för IT vid digitala prov samt hantera konton och behörigheter för elever.
* Administrera IT-system genom att registrera enheter, beställa utrustning och licenser samt samla in och arkivera datoravtal.
* Generera och hantera elevernas lösenord vid läsårsstart samt hjälpa till med låsta konton.
* Introducera nyanställda och elever till skolans IT-miljö, inloggningssystem och verktyg.


 Vaktmästeri (30%)
   

  

 Som Vaktmästare Ser Du Till Att Skolans Lokaler Och Utemiljö Är Välskötta, Säkra Och Funktionella. Arbetsuppgifterna Innefattar
   

  

* Daglig säkerhetsrond, där du ser över skolans lokaler, utemiljö och utrymningsvägar samt rapporterar skador, klotter och halkrisker.
* Månadsvis brandöversyn i REQS och säkerställande av att nödutgångar, skyltning och säkerhetsinformation är korrekt uppsatta.
* Hantering av passage- och larmsystem, inklusive nycklar och taggar.
* Underhåll och enklare reparationer av skolans inventarier, inklusive montering och utbyte av trasiga möbler.
* Inventering av lokaler, inventarier och skolgård samt planering av förbättringsåtgärder.
* Kontaktperson gentemot fastighetsägare, hantverkare och underleverantörer samt uppföljning av felanmälningar och underhållsarbeten.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är tekniskt kunnig, händig och flexibel till sättet. Du är serviceinriktad och trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av IT-support och/eller bakgrund inom fastighetsskötsel eller annat praktiskt arbete. Du är väl förtrogen med programvaror inom Officepaketet och har en god förmåga att hantera Excel och sammanställa data. Du är en problemlösare som tycker om att ta ansvar och att jobba självständigt.
   

  

**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Du är tekniskt kunnig och har en mycket god förståelse för IT och teknik.
* Du har en praktisk förmåga och kan sköta underhåll och enklare reparationer av fastighet och inventarier.
* Du är serviceinriktad och trivs med att hjälpa andra med IT och/eller praktiska arbetsuppgifter inom verksamheten.


**Krav**
* Du har erfarenhet av IT support och teknisk felsökning vilket har lagt grunden för en god kunskap om datorer, nätverk, skrivare, mjukvaruhantering och digitala system.
* Du är självgående och kan lösa tekniska och praktiska problem på egen hand.
* Du är flexibel och kan varva mellan arbetsuppgifter av olika karaktär utifrån verksamhetens behov.


**Meriterande**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete i skola och kännedom om skolans behov.
* God förmåga att hantera Excel och sammanställa data.
* Erfarenhet av fastighetsunderhåll och säkerhetsarbete.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Pedagogisk lunch
* Ett omväxlande och självständigt arbete i en trivsam skolmiljö
* Möjlighet att utvecklas inom både IT och fastighetsskötsel
* Ett härligt team av kollegor och en arbetsplats där din insats gör skillnad


 Varje dag går ca 6 000 personer till sitt jobb i Södertälje kommun. Vi har många olika roller hos oss och vill erbjuda dig ett meningsfullt jobb där du får möjlighet att bidra till samhället och samtidigt känna glädje. Som medarbetare hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas och sätta avtryck på riktigt.
   

  

 Som Anställd i Södertälje Kommun Erbjuds Du Bl.a. Trygga Anställningsvillkor, Ett Generöst Friskvårdsbidrag Samt Möjlighet Att Byta Semesterdagstillägget Mot Extra Lediga Dagar. Inom Vissa Verksamheter Finns Även Möjlighet Till Viss Flexibilitet Avseende Arbetstid Och Arbetsformer. Vi Har Ett Stort Utbud Av Utbildningar Och Kompetenshöjande Insatser För Dig Som Medarbetare. För Mer Detaljerad Information Kring Våra Förmåner Läs Gärna Mer På Vår Externa Hemsida
   

  

 https://www.sodertalje.se/formaner
   

  

 Tjänsten omfattar 100% och avser en tidsbegränsad anställning på 1 år med möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

**Välkommen till oss!**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning.
   

  

 För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Låter det här som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan till senast 2025-04-21.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Technical Success Engineer (Sweden)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
The Technical Success Engineer at Splunk is a critical team member responsible for the technical health of our customers. You will bring your deep product knowledge to advise customers on their platform health, providing guidance on Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud architectures and technical best practices to ensure customers remain successful and realize the full value of their investment in Splunk. As a Splunk Technical Success Engineer, you will support our customers on their adoption journey with product support, advisory and management of customer escalations.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Act as point of contact for technical health issues and escalation management for enterprise customers.
* Deliver customer onboarding guidance, enablement planning, administration and management workshops.
* Provide guidance, planning and recommendations for the overall technical health of a customer's Splunk environment.
* Monitor the overall health of customer environments considering cases, critical issues, outages and ongoing projects, and conduct diagnostic health checks as needed.
* Advocate internally for customers to facilitate the resolution of customer issues through coordination of efforts among Splunk’s internal organizations (technical support, services, sales, product development, product management, and executive leadership teams)
* Proactively analyze customer issues and interactions to identify training and additional services needs, engage internal teams for delivery
* Participate in sales QBRs with customers (onsite and virtually) to review service levels, usage metrics and customer environment performance.
* Work with the relevant technical teams to proactively handle customer escalations and configurations, and recommend customer environment upgrades and add-ons, ensuring upgrade readiness and new feature awareness
* Assess all cloud overages and leverage services for workload optimization solutions
* Proactively identify customer environment impacts related to bugs or new release build and track scheduled maintenance windows and communicate effectively between teams
* Understand, document and communicate the customer’s needs to the Account Team
* Keep the customer informed of key information that may be critical to their success (e.g. product roadmaps, new product releases, customer events, or organizational changes)


**Requirements**
* Knowledge of software development process and technical environments
* Experienced with customer escalations, account management and project management
* Passionately focused on customer service and success
* Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
* Ability to communicate effectively with individual contributors to senior leaders
* Work independently and as part of a team
* Experience with IT operations and technical infrastructure
* Working knowledge of Splunk Core Platform highly desirable
* Travel up to 30% may be required


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* 5+ years’ experience in technical support, professional services, systems administration/engineering or related
* 5+ years’ experience managing strategic/top accounts in the technology sector
* 5+ years’ experience in enterprise customer facing role
* Project management experience
* BA/BS technical degree, or equivalent work experience
* Working knowledge of Splunk Core platform
* Willing to pursue Splunk Architect Certification
* Familiarity with all Splunk related products (preferred)
* Fluent in English and Swedish


 Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.
   

  

 Note

title: Engineering Manager - Data & Analytics Engineering
description:
Are you ready to lead the way in data innovation at NOBA Bank Group? We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Engineering Manager to join our Data & Analytics Engineering team!
   

  

***Data & Analytics Engineering** 
 is currently defining global subgroups focused on backend, frontend, and data management. As the Engineering Manager, you will lead a cross-country team, in Norway and Stockholm, and play a crucial role in advancing our data technology and personnel. Your responsibilities include guiding data initiatives, overseeing data solution development, and collaborating across various parts of the bank. This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth, including global leadership development and engagement in exciting projects like the Common Data Platform, global data modeling, and new business reporting.*
**With Us You Can Expect**
 ✨ A flat organization with fast decision-making processes
   

  

 ✨ Development opportunities within your role and within the organization
   

  

 ✨ Freedom with responsibility
   

  

 ✨ Fun activities together with your team and the office
   

  

 ✨ A culture where feedback, coaching leadership and community are important
   

  

 NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!
   

  

**Specific Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Lead one of the teams within Data & Analytics Engineering
* Oversee data-related solutions and projects within the Analytics Engineering area.
* Provide technical guidance and oversight for data solutions.
* Assume partial product ownership or technical lead responsibilities.
* Develop and maintain Power BI reports, datasets, consumer-specific models, and data marts.
* Drive the creation and maintenance of a common data platform for future global use.
* Manage stakeholder relationships and drive change within the team.
* Recruit and develop talent within the team.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
* Holds a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field.
* Has a minimum of 5 years of work experience in data engineering or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
* Possesses strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of data professionals.
* Has in-depth knowledge of data engineering and analytics principles, tools, and technologies, including data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and data visualization.
* Is proficient in Microsoft on-premise and cloud data solutions, including MS SQL, SSIS, PBI, Azure Data Bricks, DBT, and Python.


**It Is Advantageous If You**
* Have project and product management skills, including experience with data-related project planning and execution.
* Is fluent in one of the Nordic languages


**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 To thrive in this role, you need to be a strong leader capable of driving change and managing a high-paced environment. You should excel in stakeholder management and cross-country team leadership, with a passion for innovative projects and modernization efforts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as is the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You must be goal-oriented, focused on delivering high-quality data solutions within set timelines and budgets, collaborative with cross-functional teams, and possess strong problem-solving skills. A humble and team-focused approach is also important for success!
   

  

**In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Practical Information**
**Start:** 
 By agreement
   

  

**Location** 
 : Oslo or Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Full-time
   

  

**Working hours:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

 We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.*

title: Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software
description:
Are you ready to build and lead a team that shapes the future of infrastructure solutions? Join Dustin as the Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software** 
**unique**
* Strategic Impact – Play a key role in structuring and scaling infrastructure solutions across all Dustin markets
* Growth Opportunity – Drive the future of Dustin’s infrastructure portfolio by shaping and expanding a high-potential business, combining hardware, software, and services into a strong commercial offering
* Collaborative Culture – Work for an international company where one of the core values is Win As A Team! This belief runs through our entire organization


 As Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software, you’ll be key in unlocking Dustin’s infrastructure potential by developing a focused portfolio of products and software licenses. With a significant growth opportunity, you’ll collaborate with sales teams and stakeholders to build a high-growth business across all markets, shaping the future from the ground up.
   

  

**My name is Åsa And Deschaume, and I am the VP for Infrastructure Solutions** 
**within Offering and Procurement.** 
 As a leader, I believe in empowerment and trust, giving my teams the freedom and support they need to thrive. I value open dialogue, honest conversations, and mutual respect. I enjoy working with people who are open-minded and willing to take on challenges. While I expect a lot from my team, it’s because I hold myself to the same high standards. At the same time, I bring energy and positivity to my work, creating an environment where people feel motivated to grow and succeed.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Head of Infrastructure Hardware and Software**
***Responsibility* 
 :** 
 You will be given responsibility for driving and structuring Dustin’s Infrastructure Hardware and Software portfolio, balancing standalone product and license sales with strategic offerings that empower sales teams and strengthen key brand partnerships.
 ***Collaboration* 
 :** 
 Together with your team, which is currently under construction, you take care of developing and optimising the hardware and software offering to drive growth and customer value. While the team is small, your mission is ambitious, and you'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Solution Architects and Sales to ensure a strong, strategic, and market-driven portfolio.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead and develop a small, strategic, and operational team: mentor and guide a focused team, ensuring they understand and deliver on the teammission
* Secure an attractive infrastructure portfolio: Take ownership of the infrastructure assortment, ensuring it meets market needs and drives profitable growth across all segments
* Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments: Work closely with Solution Architects, Sales, Procurement, and Marketing to align infrastructure offerings and ensure seamless execution


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives on building and leading teams, driving business growth, and shaping strategic infrastructure offerings across multiple markets.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* Experience with Offering Management, Product Management within a Vendor, Distributor, Reseller, or Operator
* Strong leadership skills, cross-cultural experience, and the ability to drive teams across countries
* Solid knowledge of the infrastructure area
* A customer-focused and self-driven mindset
* Experience with go-to-market strategies and strategic planning
* Fluency in English (our company language) and one Scandinavian language, with strong communication and presentation skills


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening TA partner Elza van Grootel-Coenraats
* 1st interview with a senior member of the management team
* Personality assessment through Assessio
* Case interview with hiring manager Åsa And Deschaume
* 3th interview - Phone call with Michael Haagen - EVP Offering & Procurement
* Reference & background check


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel-Coenraats via e-mail.

title: Transformation Lead
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Project Management
company_industry: Retail Building Materials and Garden Equipment, Engineering Services, and Information Services
description:
**Welcome to One of the World’s Oldest Start-ups!** 




  





*For over 330 years, Husqvarna Group has been a pioneer in innovation, shaping the way we interact with urban and green spaces. Our journey has been one of continuous reinvention—adapting, evolving, and staying ahead of the curve.* 




  





*Now, we’re embarking on one of our largest transformations yet, and we want you to be part of our story.* 




  





**Welcome to GIS in Husqvarna Group - We are empowering our company through sustainable technology and data.** 




  





 In this role, you will be a part of Global Information Services (GIS), which is our Global IT Department. Here, we lead digital transformation with a focus on lean thinking and agility. We drive global IT strategy execution, ensure effective governance, and provide organizational and technology capabilities - to support our business divisions. Our mission is to achieve a flexible, robust, safe, and efficient IT landscape, that supports Husqvarna Group’s business strategies and digital transformation journey.
 



  





**Your Opportunity: Shape the Future of How We Work.** 




  





 We are on a mission to reshape how Husqvarna Group operates - moving from traditional structures, to agile, empowered ways of working. This transformation is about redefining how our entire organization collaborates, makes decisions, and most importantly - drives innovation. Shaping our digital capabilities is at the core of the transformation.
 



  





 As a key leader in this journey, you will be part of driving the transformation of our IT function, ensuring that we create an efficient, flexible, and modern WoW, that aligns with the needs of our business. You will play a crucial role in leading change management projects, engaging senior stakeholders, and setting the standard for how we work with solution technology, across the entire company (globally).
 



  





 Now, we're working with different large initiatives. For example, we are on a journey to consolidate numerous ERP systems into a single, unified SAP S/4 HANA platform. This program is a cornerstone of our digital future and will require strong leadership, collaboration
 
 and execution.
 



  





 Why Join Us?
 



  





 This is an opportunity to be at the heart of one of Husqvarna Group’s most significant transformations. You will play a central role in shaping how we work, ensuring that our business is not just keeping up with digitalization but leading the way. With major initiatives in AI, Automation, ERP and process efficiency, the coming years will define the future of our company - and you will be a key driver of the change.
 



  





 Your role
 



  




* Lead the enablement and adoption of a new Lean/Agile IT operating model, moving toward a more collaborative, matrix-driven approach.
* Drive strategic initiatives focused on organizational capability development, partner collaboration and IT process & governance improvements.
* Engage with senior stakeholders within both IT and the business, ensuring alignment and buy-in.
* Shape how we integrate AI, automation, and data-driven decision-making into our operations, ensuring that Husqvarna Group remains at the forefront of digital transformation.
* Work closely with IT PMO and other IT functions, to monitor and report on the execution of strategic roa
 **dmaps and initiat** 
 ives.



  





 You will report to Vice President IT Transformation.
 



  





**What You’ll Bring** 




  




* A strong background in transformation, change management and/or business-driven technology initiatives.
* Experience in leading large-scale change management projects, particularly in driving new ways of working and senior stakeholder management.
* Experience in developing and implementing governance frameworks based on lean and ag
 **ile princ** 
 iples.



  





 About you
 



  





 You have a talent for turning complex technical concepts into engaging narratives, that inspire action across all levels of the organization, including senior stakeholders. Your mindset strikes the perfect balance between structure and flexibility, ensuring that transformation projects are both ambitious - and achievable. With great communication skills, you engage and influence senior management, business leaders and IT teams, driving meaningful
 **change w** 
 ith cl
 **arity an** 
 d impact.
 



  





 Location
 



  





 This role is based in Sweden (Jonsered, Stockholm, or Huskvarna) with travels from time to time, when the business needs.
 



  





 With our hybrid working environment, you'll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members. We meet in the office at least 2-
 **3 days a week (50** 
 %).
 



  





 Your application:
 



  





 Are you ready to lead the way? Join us and be part of Husqvarna Group’s next chapter.
 **The** 
 last day to apply i
 *s 2025-04-27, but no* 
 te that we will make an ongoing selection.
 



  





 For questions regarding the process, please contact Global
 
 Talent Acquisition Partner, Matil
 
 da Nordén matilda.nor
 *den@husqvarnagroup.com.* 




  





*About Husqvarna Group:* 




  





*Husqvarna Group is a global leader in innovative solutions for managing forests, parks, and gardens, as well as cutting equipment and diamond tools for the light construction and stone industries. With an innovative mindset, we are dedicated to deliver high-quality solutions ranging from robotic mowers to chainsaws, watering systems and power cutters, with a strong focus on our customer* 




  





*s and future generations.* 




*Founded in the Swedish town Huskvarna in 1689, we have been pioneers in our business for more than three centuries. Today, we are mainly operating under the Husqvarna and Gardena brands, serving consumers and professionals in over 100 countries through direct sales, dealers, and retailers. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Husqvarna Group employs approximately 13,300 people in 40 countries an* 
 d
 *reported net sales of SEK 48,4 billion in 202* 
 4. Husqvarna Group is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Senior IT-tekniker
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Data Services, and IT System Training and Support
description:
*Denna annons är publicerad i samarbete med Jobbet.se. Ansökan sker via Jobbet.se:s hemsida.* 




  





**Vi söker nu en senior IT-tekniker med erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Azure. Om du har en stark teknisk bakgrund och ett driv att utvecklas med ny teknik kan du vara den vi söker. Hos oss blir du en del av ett sammansvetsat team som prioriterar samarbete och personlig utveckling. Välkommen att bli en del av Rely IT!** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som senior IT-tekniker kommer du att ansvara för installation, konfiguration och underhåll av molntjänster på Azure-plattformen. Du kommer att designa, implementera och säkerställa långsiktig drift av molnbaserade lösningar samt felsöka och åtgärda tekniska problem relaterade till Azure-plattformen. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer du att säkerställa att IT-lösningarna levereras smidigt och effektivt.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 För att passa i rollen har du minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med Microsoft Azure och har djupgående kunskap om molnbaserade lösningar och tjänster. Om du har kunskap och/eller certifiering inom Linux, nätverk, Azure eller säkerhetstjänster är det meriterande. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-miljö är även det meriterande. Vidare ser vi att du har god förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper och bästa praxis.
 



  





 Du har en stark problemlösningsförmåga och ett analytiskt tänkande, du gillar att ta dig an utmaningar och hitta kreativa lösningar. I ditt arbete samarbetar du gärna med och stöttar dina kollegor för att nå gemensamma
 
 mål. Du ser till att få saker gjorda och levererar alltid med hög kvalitet. Vidare har du en god kommunikationsförmåga, du är tydlig och van att arbeta i en miljö där mycket sker på distans.
 



  





**Varför Rely IT?** 




 Vi erbjuder en innovativ arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, där du får möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens teknik. Här blir du en del av ett sammansvetsat team som prioriterar samarbete och personlig utveckling. Dessutom får du chansen att utvecklas inom området Cloud och arbeta med den allra senaste tekniken.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Tjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare.
 



  





 📍 Kyrkogatan 11 i Norrtälje
 



  





 Har du några funderingar kring rekryteringen eller tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Michelle Nyberg, på 0707429196 eller michelle.nyberg@relyit.se.
 



  





 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
 



  





**Krav** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med Microsoft Azure.
* Djupgående kunskap om molnbaserade lösningar och tjänster.



  





**Meriterande** 



* Kunskap och/eller certifiering inom Linux, nätverk, Azure eller säkerhetstjänster.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-miljö.
* Kunskap om säkerhets principer och bästa praxis.



  





**Om arbetsgivaren - Rely IT** 




*Rely IT är ett svenskt IT-konsultföretag grundat 2009 som hjälper företag med hela eller delar av deras IT-behov.* 




  





*Vi levererar trygga produkter med bästa beredskap inför framtiden genom systemlösningar byggda på erkänt stabila tekniska plattformar och standarder. Flexibilitet, snabbhet och engagemang är tre av våra viktigaste ledord i relationen med kunder.*

title: Strategic Purchaser - IT, Telecom & Digital Solutions
description:
At Seco, we’re right now looking for a driven and communicative Strategic Purchaser to join our team in the Procurement department in Fagersta. We welcome you to a high impact role with many opportunities for both personal and professional growth!
   

  

**About The Job**
 In this role, you lead the strategical purchasing activities in the areas of IT, Telecom, and Digital according to our procurement guidelines and metrics. By analyzing our portfolio and aligning IT capabilities with long-term strategic objectives and technology roadmaps, you enable a competitive advantage and digital transformation.
   

  

 You work closely with IT and other business functions to identify, lead, and manage sourcing cases in accordance with the IT roadmap within Seco and SMS (Sandvik Machining Solutions). To find synergies and drive collaboration between the divisions within SMS, you take an active part in various collaboration forums, ensuring a sustainable supplier base by integrating environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria into the procurement process. This includes evaluating suppliers' sustainability practices and promoting the adoption of green technologies and solutions.
   

  

 Further responsibilities include:
   

  

* Leading and managing sourcing projects as well as negotiating contracts and initiatives to enhance supplier cost efficiency and performance.
* Creating and following implementation of contracts.
* Acting as a speaking partner for IT and establishing relationships with key stakeholders and suppliers.
* Supporting in developing and maintaining our IT Sourcing Strategy in tight collaboration with Seco IT, business functions, and the SMS business area.
* Being accountable for master data, with supplier and price information considered.
* Leading and participating in Supplier Relationship Management activities with strategic suppliers.


 The location for this role is flexible within Sweden. Frequent visits to our headquarters in Fagersta are required, as that’s where your team are located. We offer you a hybrid work setup, allowing you to combine remote and office work. Some travel may occur.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for a senior purchaser with extensive knowledge in different IT sourcing models such as managed services, cloud computing, and infrastructure. Your background includes creating strategic partnerships with IT vendors, sourcing and procurement of digital workplace services and products such as collaboration tools, telecom, and service desk. Good business acumen is essential, as well as understanding legal matters such as contract negotiation, security and compliance (DPA, IT Safety & Security). Since we act in a truly international environment, you need experience from working in a global matrix organization and proficiency in both written and verbal English.
   

  

 We put a lot of emphasis on your personality, especially on your social skills! You have high agency and prominent interpersonal as well as communication skills, making you great at managing stakeholders. Complementing this is your drive, agility and willingness to adapt in an ever-changing environment – you’re motivated by continuous improvements and thrive when you get to lead your own work forward.
   

  

**Our Seco culture**
 Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Anna Pettersen, recruitment specialist, anna.pettersen@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

 David Romlin, Unionen, +46 (0)70-608 46 90
   

  

 Suncana Bandalo, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-300 10 73
   

  

 Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-523 50 60
   

  

 Hiring Manager: Malin Jakobsson
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send us your application no later than April 24, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0077986.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*At Seco Tools we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.*

title: Head of Value Chain Operations,  Malmö or Stockholm
description:
**A Powerful Partnership** 




 St1 Biokraft is a joint venture between St1, HitecVision, and Aneo, combining expertise and resources to drive innovation in the biogas industry. The aim is to become a leading integrated biogas player in the Nordics, contributing significantly to the energy transition. The company covers the entire biogas value chain, from feedstock sourcing to distribution and end-user sales, with a goal to achieve 3 TWh biomethane production and 6 TWh biomethane sales by 2030, focusing on heavy transport, maritime, and industrial applications.
 



 Over 1 billion EUR will be allocated to biogas production and distribution networks across the Nordics to facilitate this growth. Several significant projects are underway to enhance the infrastructure and boost operations to meet ambitious targets.
 



  





  





**Join a Green Energy Pioneer – Head of Value Chain Operations, St1 Biokraft** 




  





 St1 Biokraft is on an exciting growth journey, expanding our footprint and transforming the future of renewable energy. As the Head of Value Chain Operations, you will play a central role in shaping our operational capabilities – from production to distribution and customer delivery. You will lead a team of professionals and ensure seamless, cost-efficient, and sustainable operations throughout the entire value chain.
 



 This is a high-impact leadership role where strategy meets execution. It is ideal for individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment. The position is based in Malmö or Stockholm, and you will report to our Head of Value Chai
 **n.** 




  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Lead and Develop Our Value Chain Operations
* Drive Business Growth and Strategic Development
* Ensure Compliance and Drive Sustainability
* Own the Numbers



  





 As Head of Value Chain Operations, you will be responsible for the entire operational flow from suppliers to end customers. The role includes capacity planning, grid fee optimisation and logistics related to gas/methane and mobile storage. You ensure timely and accurate deliveries, high customer satisfaction and strong relationships with suppliers and contractors.
 



  





 The role has a clear commercial dimension. You hold P&L responsibility for the operational part of the value chain and make data-driven decisions that balance cost, efficiency and customer value, both in daily operations and long-term planning. Collaborating closely with the trading and portfolio teams, you support business case development and identify new gas sourcing opportunities. You also work with commercial teams on pricing models, contract structures and volume planning – all contributing to the strategic growth of St1 Biokraft’s business portfolio. Compliance and sustainability are integral to the role. You ensure operations meet ADR, safety, tax, and environmental regulations and collaborate closely with the sustainability team to support decarbonisation efforts. Risk management, internal and external reporting, and incident follow-up (IA systems) are within your scope, ensuring a robust and forward-looking value chain.
 



  





  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 To succeed in this role, you likely hold a Master’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field, with a minimum of five years of experience in supply chain, logistics, or operations. You have a proven track record of leadership and implementing change in complex environments, combined with a strong operational understanding and a strategic mindset. You are analytical and data-driven, confident working with tools such as Excel, Power BI, and ERP systems (Business Central is a plus). You also bring experience in logistics optimisation and are well-versed in regulatory frameworks, including ADR, customs, and environmental legislation. Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in Swedish is considered an advantage.
 



  





**Who You Are** 




 You are a strategic thinker with sharp operational instincts, driven by results and business value. As a leader, you are hands-on, inspiring, and capable of building and developing high-performing teams. You navigate complexity with pragmatism, solve problems proactively, and thrive in a dynamic environment. You communicate clearly, negotiate confidently, and always look ahead – a true change agent who gets things done.
 



  





  





**Why St1 B** 




 iokraft?We’re not just producing biogas – we’re redefining the sourcing, delivery, and experience of energy. You will join a team with a strong mission, rapid growth, and high ambitions. Here, your impact is significant and your development opportunities are extensive. Are you ready to lead the future of green energy logistics?
 



  





  





**Applications** 




 Interested? Apply today and join St1 Biokraft – a workplace where your expertise makes a difference. Do you have questions about the role or the company? Don’t hesitate to contact us!
 



  





 Please submit your application to our recruitment system (for data security reasons, we cannot receive applications by e-mail). Do you have any questions? Contact our recruitment manager, Pernilla Borgström, at +46 734-159855 or pernilla.borgstrom@st1biokraft.com.

title: Linux Drifttekniker till SAAB
description:
Är du en erfaren Linux tekniker med ett starkt säkerhetstänk och en passion för systemförvaltning, serverdrift och automatisering? Vill du vara en del av ett team som arbetar med att skapa säkra och effektiva IT-lösningar inom en högteknologisk miljö? Då kan detta vara rätt utmaning för dig!
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att bygga vidare på sin karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som Linux Drifttekniker blir du en nyckelspelare i teamet som ansvarar för förvaltning och vidareutveckling av tekniska tjänster till Saabs verksamhet. Ditt arbete kommer att säkerställa tillgängligheten av system och digitala tjänster, vilket ställer höga krav på säkerhet, stabilitet och noggrannhet. Du kommer också att ha en central roll i leverans- och supportflödet av IT-tjänster.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Standardisera, effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Delta i projekt kopplade till teknikplattformen
* Arbeta inom drift- och supportteamet med felsökning och installationer
* Hantera patchning och uppgraderingar av servermiljön
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av gällande säkerhetskrav
* Aktivt delta i teknikförbättringsarbete


**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker dig med ett starkt teknikintresse och gedigen erfarenhet inom Linux-området. Du har arbetat i större driftsmiljöer och hanterat olika varianter av operativsystem. Du är noggrann, serviceinriktad och trivs med att arbeta i team.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen som Linux Drifttekniker ser vi att du har:**
* Minst 4–8 års erfarenhet inom LINUX med fokus på serverdrift
* Goda kunskaper i scriptspråk som Bash eller Python
* Säkerhetstänk kring automatiserad konfigurationsstyrning
* Stort tekniskt intresse och förmåga att hålla dig uppdaterad inom området
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Red Hat, SUSE Manager eller liknande verktyg
* Erfarenhet av Ansible, Docker och Kubernetes
* Kunskap inom systemhärdning


**Övrig information**
* Resor inom Sverige förekommer – B-körkort är önskvärt
* Befattningen kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt gällande bestämmelser


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Mer om oss
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Product Area Lead Customer Journey
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 The Area Lead for Customer Journey sets the vision and strategy for the Area. The Area Customer Journey is a new and exciting area of high strategic importance, and you will have the opportunity to be innovative and to set the portfolio, including products and services. This role also owns the commercial success of the Product Area, including P&L, go-to-market and pricing. The Area Lead for Customer Journey works closely with the other Area Leads and across the cross functional teams in the organization.
   

  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES** 
 :
   

  

* Set vision and strategy for the product area.
* Initiate market research and competitor analysis to understand market potential and growth drivers.
* Run continuous internal and external discovery.
* Set the Recommender journey portfolio, including products and services.
* Lead cross-functional teams to develop and support our customers, specifically the prescribing recommenders, such as Speech Language Pathologists.
* Establish product roadmaps based on overarching business objectives and directions.
* Ensure the commercial success of the product area, including P&L; analyze gaps between actuals and forecasts, and drive mitigation activities with Market Sales.
* Set pricing and distribution strategy for the product area.
* Represent the product area publicly at internal and external events.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**
* Master's or bachelor's degree.
* Experience in strategy work.
* Leadership and strong team player experience.
* Experience with product discovery.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Strong commercial and business acumen from driving go-to-market strategies.
* Relevant field experience from customer experience or product management.
* Excellent communication skills in English is essential both in written and spoken format and on stage.
* Strong internal drive and motivation to challenge the status quo.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to gather teams around common objectives.
* Thorough understanding of great customer experiences.


**WORK ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS:**
* Stockholm based, flexible home/office, prefer office minimum 3 times per week.
* Domestic and International travel on a regular basis, especially to the USA.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Manager Digital Workplace Solutions
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva utvecklingen av framtidens digitala arbetsplats på ICA? Vi söker nu en Manager Digital Workplace som vill vara med och forma hur teknik, användarupplevelse och affärsvärde möts i en av Sveriges mest välkända koncerner.*
**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som Manager Digital Workplace har du det övergripande ansvaret för att leda transformation av ICAs digitala arbetsmiljö – med fokus på Microsoft 365, generativ AI, Intranät och andra moderna teknologier. Du ansvarar för både strategi, roadmap och förvaltning och leder ett team bestående av både interna resurser och externa partners.
   

  

 Rollen är central för att forma en modern digital arbetsplats med hög hastighet på införande av ny teknik (såsom Generativ AI, agenter), säkerställa användarvänliga och effektiva verktyg samt skapa förutsättningar för innovation, kommunikation, samarbete och ett modernt arbetssätt.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och implementera strategi för hur digitala verktyg inom området ska användas inom hela ICAs koncern
* Leda teamet och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med IT, verksamhet, externa leverantörer och ledningsgrupper
* Säkerställa kvalitet, stabilitet och kostnadseffektivitet i digitala lösningar
* Utveckla intranät och andra kommunikationsplattformar
* Optimera användningen av Microsoft 365 och generativ AI
* Ansvara för budget, leverans och licenshantering inom området


**Om dig**
*För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:*
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att leda digitala förändringsprojekt inom större organisationer
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Microsoft 365 och förståelse för vad som skapar en modern digital arbetsplats
* Erfarenhet av att leda team och samarbeta med olika typer av intressenter
* Förmåga att kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt genomförande
* God kommunikativ förmåga och vana att bygga relationer, internt och externt


**Därför ska du välja ICA**
 Vill du göra varje dag lite enklare ihop med oss? Det är nämligen precis det vi vill göra. För våra kunder och för oss själva. Vi vill att alla ska kunna må bättre, handla bekvämare, laga bättre mat och leva i ett mer hållbart samhälle. Och det är du och vi tillsammans som gör det här. För att lyckas med det måste vi hela tiden utmana oss själva. Vi måste jobba ihop för att behålla bra relationer, goda samarbeten och det där starka entreprenörsdrivet för att fortsätta att utvecklas. Innovation och digitalisering är otroligt viktigt för oss. Det är så vi hittar lösningar som håller för framtiden. När det gäller din egen utveckling är det också rätt bra att vi är så stora som vi är och jobbar inom så många olika områden. Det betyder att du kan hitta din egen väg framåt och påverka hur du själv ska utvecklas och växa. Allt det här kombinerat tycker vi skapar riktigt bra förutsättningar för att du och vi ska kunna hänga ihop riktigt länge – och ha kul längs vägen.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Du ansöker till rollen genom att skicka in ditt CV via Easy Apply på LinkedIn.
   

  

 https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/4199298746
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du gör det så snart som möjligt, då urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag den 30 april.
   

  

 https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/4199298746
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar ICA Gruppen med Navigio. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Victoria Ivanova på
 *victoria.ivanova@navigio.se.*
 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IAM-specialist
description:
**Är du en erfaren IAM-konsult med erfarenhet och hög kompetens inom IAM-området och söker nästa utmaning? Kanske sitter du i en roll idag som IAM-specialist, IAM-analyst eller liknande och nyfiken på en ny utmaning?** 




  





 Då är du varmt välkommen att hänga med på Avegas framgångsresa och fortsätta att utveckla vårt Säkerhetserbjudande!
 



  





 Avega är ett konsultföretag inom digital transformation och innovation. Hos oss hittar du erfarna specialistkonsulter som tar ledande och rådgivande nyckelroller hos kunderna. Vi erbjuder dig:
 


* En dynamisk arbetsplats med härliga kollegor
* Ett konsultuppdrag som du är med och väljer, utifrån ditt intresseområde och erfarenhet. Enligt vår matchningsprincip 1:1 siktar vi på en 100% matchning mellan kund och konsult för att försäkra oss om att du får arbeta i spännande uppdrag
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, inte bara i ditt uppdrag men även genom Avegas kompetensforum Elevate
* Roliga bolagsaktiveter och fantastiska nätverksmöjligheter



  





 Som IAM-konsult kommer du att arbeta i kunduppdrag där du t ex är ansvarig för att designa, implementera och hantera IAM-lösningar för våra kunder. Några av dina arbetsuppgifter kan sträcka sig från att analysera kundernas IAM-behov och identifiera potentiella säkerhetsrisker, utveckla och presentera skräddarsydda IAM-strategier och IAM-lösningar. Man kan jobba med allting från design och implementering, till säkerhetsanalys och riskhantering och efterlevnad.
 



 Därför lägger vi stort fokus på konsultens tekniska expertis kring olika IAM-tekniker och plattformar, samt att man även känner sig bekväm med att erbjuda teknisk support till kunder och felsöka och åtgärda tekniska problem i IAM-miljöer.
 



  





 Då Avega vill ligga i framkant med de senaste möjligheterna ser vi även att man vill hålla sig uppdaterad om de senaste IAM-trenderna och teknologierna, och att man kan bidra till utvecklingen av kundens IAM-tjänster och metoder.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT-säkerhet eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IAM-design, implementering och hantering
* Djupgående kunskaper om IAM-tekniker som t ex Active Directory och plattformar som Azure AD, Okta eller andra ledande IAM-plattformar
* Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och integrera IAM-verktyg och -plattformar, inklusive SSO, MFA, RBAC och PIM/PAM
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med kunder och leverera konsulttjänster
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och problemlösningsförmåga



  





**Meriterande kvalifikationer** 



* Certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet och IAM är meriterande
* Konsultbakgrund eller erfarenhet inom flera olika branscher



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* Självgående och initiativtagande
* Analytisk och noggrann
* Teamorienterad och samarbetsvillig
* Flexibel och anpassningsbar



  





 Om detta låter som en spännande utmaning för dig är du varmt välkommen att söka! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.

title: Manager - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 As a Manager at BCG Platinion in the Nordics, you are responsible for the execution and management of our national and international client projects. We collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on site and directly with the client company. The Manager role incorporates structuring the project and performing the required resource planning. Besides the functional navigation of the project members, you will also be involved operationally in the project business. Together with our clients, you will develop convincing IT strategies, concepts and solutions, applying technical know-how and extensive experience in structuring IT projects, just as analytical and conceptual skills. We independently support our clients, present our results to their decision makers, and agree on the next steps.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* bring a completed a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, or a related area with above-average grades
* have at least eight years of substantial experience in IT consulting and the lead design and management of IT strategy and implementation projects
* already captured project-related management experience as the lead of teams with more than five people
* know how to plan IT initiatives and build solid business cases
* optimally steer decisions towards the goal and master escalating situations with an eye to solutions - even in complex organizational structures
* have successfully acquired consulting projects
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Independently contribute to build close client relationships - and as their trusted advisor, you are the first to whom they turn
