* Acquire new projects and challenges for our company and yourself
* Be in charge of planning, leading, and assuring quality for strategic IT projects - we work with passion for our clients' long-term success
* Get to use your comprehensive knowledge of technology and industry understanding to provide both internal and external stakeholders with the orientation they need in critical project phases and challenging situations
* Think across projects and connecting factors, and plan resources to achieve the best efficiency possible
* Take ownership for presenting key project results at the highest level of client management
* Work with an entrepreneurial approach and passion to advance BCG Platinion with your contributions to people development, recruiting, and practice areas


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Junior Accountant (summer internship)
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer** 
 .
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 To ensure smooth financial operations over the summer, we’re looking for a
 **Junior Accountant** 
 to join our team. You’ll support the Group Accounting and Reporting teams, as well as other Finance and Legal functions, with a variety of qualified tasks in accounting, financial reporting, internal controls, audit, and more.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone at the beginning of their finance or accounting career who’s eager to grow, contribute to important processes, and gain hands-on experience in an international fast-paced environment.
   

  

 We're looking for a first- or second-year university student with a genuine interest in learning how accounting and reporting work in a listed company. Ideally, you’ll be available to work on an hourly basis starting in May 2025 and support us throughout the summer vacation period. For the right person, there may also be an opportunity to continue supporting us during busy periods throughout the year.
   

  

 The responsibilities may include the following areas:
   

  

* Reporting and consolidation: Support the Group Accounting team with internal financial reporting and consolidation when needed on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis. In connection with this you will support reporting entities with reporting and systems related questions and tasks.
* System administration: In cooperation with other Group Accounting team members, you will work with the administration of the group reporting system Aaro, including the integration between Aaro and the global ERP system M3 as well as other reporting uploads.
* Internal controls: Support the Group Finance teams with performance and uploads of internal controls.
* Audit support: Help prepare and upload documentation for external audits.
* Entity information administration: Work with the Group Accounting and Legal teams to keep our entity information site up to date.
* Legal entity accounting and reporting: Support the Finance Manager for Swedish entities with accounting tasks.
* Project participation: Contribute to finance-related projects as needed.


**What You Bring**
* Ongoing university studies in Accounting, Financial Analysis, or a related field
* A genuine interest in accounting, financial reporting, and process improvement
* A positive, proactive attitude and eagerness to learn
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams
* Capability to create structure and improve processes and ways of working
* Professional proficiency in English and Swedish.


**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. The position offers plenty of opportunity to learn how Group Accounting is organized in a global listed company.
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the
 **15th of April 2025.**
 For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.
   

  

 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Global Quality Management System Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As our Global Quality Management System Manager, you will support the daily activities of Tobii Dynavox and partners in delivering high quality products by leading the design and implementation of a compliant, centralized and simplified quality framework across the group and continuously improving it. Your role will be key in harmonizing Process Quality review with Group Business Objectives by driving Quality projects and support projects in quality compliance matters.
   

  

 You will be part of our global Quality Assurance and Regulatory team, as a responsible for
 **Group Quality Certificates** 
 and Subject Matter Expert for Non-Product Software Validation (NPSS),
 **Quality Management System (QMS** 
 ), Document Control, Internal and External Audits, and Training.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Plan and execute Global Quality Audits (internal, supplier, partners) using a risk-based model, including audit frequency, duration, and number of auditors.
* Lead corrective actions and risk mitigation plans in response to Certification Body audit findings or compliance issues.
* Adopt digital Quality tools and Solutions to streamline quality documentation, workflows, and compliance in collaboration with the IT team.
* Design and maintain dashboards for real-time quality performance monitoring. Identify potential quality risks and provide actionable recommendations to mitigate issues prior to strategic decisions.
* Coordinate development of Group Quality Objectives and their integration in the Operational Planning. Monitor and report on Key Process performance metrics to senior leadership, identifying areas for process optimization.
* Collaborate with Quality Operations and Performance Manager for consistent quality practices and support our Business Excellence team in implementing governance policies across the Group.
* Conduct thorough quality assessments as part of the due diligence process for mergers, acquisitions, or partnerships.
* Draft and update Intra-company quality agreements.
* Lead global training programs, competency assessments, and initiatives to foster a proactive quality culture.


**Please note:** 
 Our core working hours are 8:30 am-5:30 pm from Monday to Friday. We have flexibility working hours to collaborate better and globally. This is a full-time
 **on-site** 
 role at our office in
 **Stockholm city** 
 with flexibility to work remotely one-two days when needed.
   

  

**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Quality Management, Life Sciences, or a related field.
* 7 years of experience with quality management systems, preferably for Group Certification and in a global organization in regulated industries (i.e. medical device and pharmaceutical).
* Advanced knowledge and experience in compliance with ISO 13485, FDA QSR, and MDR. Experience with other relevant international regulations on product quality and safety standards are preferred.
* Previous experience in planning and leading audits (internal, supplier, and external), including risk-based audit models is required. Previous experience on quality assessments as part of due diligence for mergers, acquisitions, or partnerships is highly appreciated.
* Ability to design effective and lean QMS structures with an understanding of quality documentation, and compliance workflows.
* Expertise in quality risk management, CAPA processes, and process quality review methodologies and familiarity with non-product software validation (NPSS).
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to identify potential quality risks, providing actionable recommendations and report on key process performance metrics to senior leadership.
* Cross-functional collaboration and leadership skills to align global objectives with business operations and foster a proactive quality culture.


**Please note:** 
 If you have any trainings or certifications such as
   

  

* Certified ISO 13485 Auditor, Certified Quality Auditor (CQA), Certified Quality Manager (CQM), or similar certifications (e.g., ASQ, IRCA) please mention or attach them in your application. We look forward to hear from you!


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Förvaltningsledare för ärendehanteringssystemet Artvise
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Vi söker förvaltningsledare för ärendehanteringssystemet Artvise till kanslienheten på kommunledningskontoret. Artvise är ett av de system som Sollentuna kommun använder för intern och extern ärendehantering, i syfte strukturera och effektivt hantera olika typer av kundärenden.
   

  

 Som förvaltningsledare för Artvise ansvarar du för förvaltning och framförallt utveckling av systemets funktion och drift. Du arbetar både på operativ och taktisk nivå, vilket innebär att du har ansvar för att systemet fungerar i vardagen samtidigt som du tillsammans med användare och leverantör ständigt förbättrar och driver systemets utveckling framåt.
   

  

 Bland arbetsuppgifterna ingår till exempel:
   

  

 fånga upp önskemål och behov från användarna för kravställning mot leverantören och se till att förbättringar och anpassningar blir realiserade
   

  

* planera, beställa och godkänna förändringar, uppgraderingar, acceptanstester och utvecklingsinsatser
* vara ett löpande stöd för användare i systemet inklusive administrera användare och behörigheter
* ansvar för att utbilda användarna gällande systemets funktioner samt vara rådgivande kring effektiva arbetssätt utifrån systemets möjligheter
* ta fram och hålla användardokumentation såsom manualer m.m. uppdaterade
* upprätta annan relevant dokumentation om förvaltningsobjektet
* sammankalla och leda förvaltningsmöten tillsammans med leverantören samt med andra roller i organisationen som t.ex. förvaltningsledare IT, digitaliseringsledare, dataskyddssamordnare.
* följa upp avtal och licenser och hålla i övrig kontakt med leverantören
* ansvara för att systemet hanterar information i enlighet med all relevant lagstiftning, bland annat informationssäkerhet, integritetslagstiftning och IT-säkerhet ur ett tekniskt perspektiv
* ansvara för att säkerställa kontinuitetplanering och kommunikation vid driftsstopp
* ansvara för årlig planering och uppföljning av budget och aktiviteter för förvaltningsobjektet


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 I den här rollen har du många olika kontaktytor såväl internt som externt, vilket ställer höga krav på förmåga att samarbeta och skapa relationer med andra. Du är serviceinriktad och har ett professionellt kundbemötande samtidigt som du har lätt att sätta dig in i verksamhetens behov och se lösningar. Att du tar ansvar, är resultatorienterad och självgående med förmåga att planera och strukturera din vardag på ett effektivt sätt ser vi som självklart.
   

  

 Du har en universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom relevant område, eller har förvärvat motsvarande erfarenhet i arbetslivet. Du har också erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som systemförvaltare, förvaltningsledare eller motsvarande roll i en större organisation. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i Artvise eller något annat likvärdigt ärendehanteringssystem. Du talar och skriver flytande svenska.
   

  

 Övriga nödvändiga kvalifikationer är:
   

  

* Vana vid leverantörsstyrning
* Nödvändig teknisk kompetens för att förstå samband till IT-infrastruktur och systemets beroende till andra system
* Kunskap om informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med PM3 som förvaltningsmodell


 Vi erbjuder
   

  

 Du blir en del av den administrativa avdelningen som består av sex enheter: digitalisering, IT, internservice, kansli, kontaktcenter och överförmyndaren. Hos oss möter du en nytänkande grupp som tycker att digitalisering och innovation är vägen framåt. Vårt mål är att ge den absolut bästa servicen till invånare och medarbetare!
   

  

 Vi har höga ambitioner och bred kompetens inom flera olika områden. Här finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och nya karriärvägar för den som vill.
   

  

 Sollentuna kommun satsar på digital utveckling och med den kommer behov av att förvalta valda system och digitala lösningar. Som anställd i Sollentuna kommun erbjuds du ett roligt, stimulerande och utmanade uppdrag. Du är med i arbetet med att göra Sollentuna lite bättre för varje dag för kommuninvånarna.
   

  

 Vi värnar om ett gott arbetsklimat som möjliggör ett hållbart arbetsliv, bland annat genom att vi tillämpar flextid, erbjuder kompetensutveckling, friskvårdsbidrag, möjlighet till distansarbete och semesterväxling.
   

  

 Förmåner för dig som är anställd i Sollentuna kommun
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och gör urval löpande.
   

  

 Den här tjänsten kan komma att säkerhetsklassas. Tjänsten förutsätter svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Sollentuna – en kommun mitt i möjligheterna! Tillsammans gör vi Sollentuna bättre varje dag för våra invånare, företagare och organisationer. Vi har tydliga och ambitiösa mål för att skapa trygghet, välfärd och hållbar tillväxt. Vi erbjuder dig ett meningsfullt och roligt jobb i en stabil miljö där ambitionsnivån är hög. Hos oss får du fantastiska kollegor som vill göra skillnad för andra. Nu söker vi dig som är nytänkande, ansvarstagande och välkomnande. Följ med oss på resan mot att skapa Sveriges mest attraktiva kommun!
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Sollentuna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/101 | Kontakt: Anneli Tjäder 0857922680, | Publicerat: 2025-04-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-24

title: Sustainability Controller
description:
**About The Role**
 Sustainability is at core of Instabee's business model and we drive it as an integral part of our company vision and strategy. We are now looking for an analytical Sustainability Controller that can lead our sustainability reporting and compliance. You will perform our carbon accounting for internal and external reporting, keep us up to date on regulations such as CSRD, and support strategic sustainability projects.
   

  

**Some Of The Things You Will Do**
* Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g., carbon emissions and energy consumption. Ensure quality of data through triangulation.
* Sustainability / carbon accounting: Own the carbon accounting model and logic. Track and analyse sustainability KPIs to monitor progress and identify areas for improvement.
* Reporting: Develop sustainability performance reports and data submissions, e.g., annual sustainability report, EU Taxonomy report, and investor/merchant surveys. Manage external assurance processes for key sustainability disclosures (e.g., carbon accounting verification.
* Compliance with regulations and frameworks: Project lead the implementation of CSRD and double materiality assessment. Stay up to date with existing and coming regulations and industry standards and support the business to proactively manage these.
* Support strategic projects: Support the sustainability team in decision making and impact projects by providing data-driven insights and documentation, e.g., cost benefit analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Engage with internal stakeholders to communicate sustainability performance, assess sustainability risks, and educate on sustainability-related issues. Collaborate with external stakeholders (e.g., regulators, NGOs, industry groups) to align with broader sustainability efforts.
* Continuous improvement and innovation: Develop Instabee accounting and reporting processes to align with best practices in terms of quality and efficiency.


**Your Future Team**
 You will be part of the Global Sustainability team at Instabee, but you will also work very closely with our Operations and other parts of the organization to collect data and communicate sustainability performance and insights. You will report to the Sustainability Project Manager.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 2-4 years of experience in sustainability reporting
* Experience with carbon accounting according to GHG Protocol
* Experience from managing data collection and projects with multiple stakeholders
* Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, driving insights and ensuring data quality
* Understanding of sustainability regulations, experience from working with CSRD and double materiality assessment is a merit
* Self-driven, used to drive your own work, identifying issues and solving them
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, working collaboratively with stakeholders across the organization to achieve shared goals.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, ensuring effective communication. Beneficial with fluency in Swedish.
* University education in a relevant area


*If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!*
**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get To know Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Security and SHEQ Manager, Sweden/DACH
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
**Olivier Dussutour** 
 , our CEO, is seeking for a Security and SHEQ (Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality) Manager to uphold top standards of security, safety and quality frameworks.
   

  

 If you thrive in tech and international environments this might be the right opportunity for you. You will have the opportunity to shape and impact a security-aware organization across Europe, helping us reinforce our core business of trust.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage with various departments to cultivate a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
* Lead initiatives that prioritize sustainability and environmental responsibility.
* At Nexus, part of IN Groupe, we are leaders in high-tech trust and safety solutions. As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you'll be a pivotal player in a company where trust is central. Your work will have a significant impact on our commitment to innovation and the standards we set in the industry.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you will be the key figure overseeing comprehensive security programs across the Nordics and Germany, with a primary focus on general security and safety. A special focus will be on physical security and business continuity. You will also act as the Chief of security in tenders and in client interactions. You will develop and implement strategies to protect assets, facilities, and personnel, while also managing SHEQ systems to promote a culture of safety, compliance, and operational excellence throughout the organization.
   

  

 Responsibilities includes
   

  

* Develop and implement comprehensive physical security policies, protocols and procedures to safeguard facilities, personnel, and assets.
* Work closely with our corporate information security team to ensure seamless integration of cybersecurity and physical security measures for a unified security approach.
* Lead and conduct risk assessments for both physical security and SHEQ aspects; develop and execute effective mitigation strategies.
* Manage security personnel and coordinate with facilities management to maintain secure environments across locations.
* Develop, implement, and maintain robust SHEQ management systems in compliance with regulatory standards and organizational goals and liaison with group counterparts to cascade group policy.
* Lead incident investigations related to security breaches and SHEQ incidents; implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for SHEQ initiatives; report on performance to senior management.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance safety, environmental sustainability, and overall quality standards organization-wide.


**About You**
* You take pride in your meticulous approach, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in every task.
* You confidently express your ideas and decisions, driving projects forward effectively.
* You enjoy anticipating needs and opportunities, taking initiative to address issues and drive improvements.
* You excel at analyzing complex situations, deriving meaningful insights from data.
* You maintain positivity and adaptability in overcoming challenges and setbacks.


**Qualifications**
* You possess a relevant academic degree.
* You are experienced in the Security field.
* You are fluent in Swedish and proficient English.
* You are experienced with ISO 9001.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* You are experienced in Tech and infrastructure.
* You are familiar with ISO 27001, ISO 14001 and TISAX.
* You are experienced in SOA classification.


**About Your Application**
 Please note that due to summer vacations, the feedback on applications may be slower during the month of July. However, we encourage you to apply as we will review all applications and respond as soon as possible.
   

  

**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Please upload your CV in English**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: HR Business Partner
description:
Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Be the point of contact for managers and employees in all HR-related matters
* Offer specialized knowledge and advice on a wide range of HR topics
* Implement strategic HR projects as well as the roll out of HR systems and tools
* Define workforce demands, develop the talent pipeline and implement talent development programs in alignment with the business
* Minimize legal and compliance risks
* Anticipate conflicts between different parties and mediate when necessary
* Implement organizational development measures


**Your Qualifications**
* University degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or comparable qualification
* Profound HR work experience in the industrial sector
* Experience with state-of-the-art HR methods and tools
* Sound knowledge of labor law
* Knowledge of SAP and SuccessFactors is an advantage
* Fluent English skills (in word and writing)
* High interpersonal and excellent communication skills as well as structured working method


 As a global company with employees around the world, it is important to us that we treat each other with respect and value all ideas and perspectives. By appreciating our differences, we inspire creativity and drive innovation. In this way, we contribute to sustainable value creation for our stakeholders and society as a whole. Together, we advance how the world moves.
   

  

 Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your online application.
   

  

 Information on our understanding of leadership can be found here: www.schaeffler.com/leadership.
   

  

 www.schaeffler.com/careers
   

  

**Your Contact**
 Schaeffler Sverige AB
   

  

 Jenny Persson
   

  

 Keywords: Experienced; Professional; Full-Time; Unlimited; Human Resources;

title: (Senior) Consultant Financial Risk (f|m|x)
description:
zeb is one of the leading strategy, management and IT consultancies specializing in financial services in Europe. We support banks, insurance companies and (tech) service providers in dealing with all the challenges and opportunities arising from transformation in the industry.
   

  

 Your tasks:
   

  

 Dependent on your seniority level your daily tasks will conclude in:
   

  

* Take an active role working on high-profile international projects with clients.
* Solve complex real-world quantitative challenges.
* Work with complex data sets developing risk models and analytics tools.
* Support senior colleagues in their daily client work, e.g. write management reports, perform controls, financial reporting, attend client meetings.
* Development of internal projects.
* Development of presentation material.
* Deep dive analysis within a broad range of topics required for senior colleagues.


 Your skills:
   

  

* Academic degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative subject such as Mathematics/Financial mathematics, Physics, Computer Science etc with a solid academic record from a top tier university.
* Earlier part-time jobs/internships at a management consulting firm and/or a financial service company.
* Strong interest in finance.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build trust with colleagues, stakeholders, and partners.
* Good communication skills with the ability to present information, insights and conclusions in a credible way to various stakeholder.
* Knowledge of the Microsoft office package (Excel, Powerpoint) or with a desire to learn.
* Programming skills in Python or other quantitative language.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills (fluent in English and Swedish). A plus but not a must: Additional European language, preferably German. #jobspreader


**Your Benefits**
* Insurances & Pension Schemes: Safely on the road with zeb—in Germany, you are also privately insured via a group accident insurance policy. For business trips abroad, there is an additional travel health insurance and you can also take out a company pension plan with zeb.
* Job & Family: Do you have questions about the compatibility of consulting and raising a family? In the workingparents@zeb network you will find support and answers.
* Mobile Work: Thanks to our technical equipment, remote work is possible from anywhere – regardless of whether you are on the train, at home or in the office.
* zeb.life: Your life is changing—and we would like to accompany you through the different phases. zeb.life offers you support for example in childcare, life situation management and eldercare or in finding concierge services.


 Equal opportunities for all: we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. As an employer, we rely on people who like to try new things, take responsibility and inspire others through their actions.

title: Procurement Manager
company_industry: Services for Renewable Energy and Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
 



  





 Today, Ingrid Capacity is in a rapid growth phase with a historic expansion of energy storage in Sweden, while also expanding internationally. We are in the final phase of construction of around 200 MW and will soon enter a new phase of construction of another 200 MW, with a total development pipeline of over 5 GW across Europe.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are looking for a motivated and dynamic Procurement Manager for our growing team to help manage all aspects of our procurement processes. Your work will contribute to ensuring efficiency, cost effectiveness and timely delivery of goods and services. You will be involved in supplier and sub-supplier market analysis, forecasting technology trends, pricing and lead times. You will also participate in strategic sourcing of equipment and construction suppliers, working closely with various teams. You will process and present data to effectively monitor contracts, verify and record commercial benefits, track the status of procurement projects, perform cost-benefit analyses, and assess commercial risk. The role includes traveling. You will report directly to the Head of Procurement.
 



  





**Key tasks and responsibilities** 




  





**Supplier and Sub-supplier Market Analysis** 



* Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify potential suppliers and understand underlying cost drivers.
* Monitor industry trends, technological advancements, pricing fluctuations, and lead times to inform procurement decisions.
* Develop strategies based on market insights to optimize procurement outcomes.



  





**Sourcing, Screening, and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM)** 



* Source and screen suppliers to ensure alignment with ESG, bankability, quality, cost, and delivery requirements.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, negotiating contracts and terms to achieve favorable agreements.
* Implement effective supplier performance evaluation processes and drive continuous improvement through SRM practices.



  





**Strategic Procurement and Collaboration** 



* Collaborate closely with Financial, Construction, Engineering, and Development teams to understand project requirements and timelines to optimize value.
* Develop or support strategic procurement plans aligned with project objectives, budget constraints, and quality standards.
* Lead and support procurement efforts for equipment and construction suppliers, ensuring adherence to project timelines and specifications.



  





**Contract Management and Support** 



* Support the construction team during project execution by managing contracts, including drafting, negotiation, and execution.
* Ensure compliance with contractual terms, specifications, and regulatory requirements.
* Resolve any procurement-related issues or disputes that may arise during the construction phase.



  





**Your work experience** 



* Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Procurement, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in procurement or sourcing or supplier management.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and make data driven decisions.
* Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Master’s degree preferred.
* Knowledge of contract law and experience in contract management.
* Experience in procurement in the construction or engineering industry.
* Knowledge and experience with renewables business provides a favorable aspect.
* Proficiency in procurement software and ERP systems.



  





 The experience listed above would all be interesting to add to the team, but you don't need experience in all of them to apply. You will work with a very knowledgeable team, so it is more important that you have the willingness and motivation to learn new skills.
 



  





**Your personal skills** 




 In addition to relevant work experience, we’re looking for someone with the right personal skills and motivation, and a genuine passion for renewable energy. To be successful in this role at Ingrid Capacity, you should have strong analytical skills, excellent negotiation skills and a strategic mindset. Effective communication and interpersonal skills are essential for building and maintaining supplier relationships and collaborating with internal teams. You thrive in a high-growth environment and enjoy taking ownership. At Ingrid Capacity we encourage self-leadership and knowledge sharing, and therefore we believe that you enjoy working independently and driving your work forward, while also collaborating closely with other functions.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
 



 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
 



  





**Application** 




 Sounds like a match? Don’t be a stranger and welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: PART TIME SALES ADVISOR
description:
**Part time Sales Advisor** 




  





 ATP Atelier is a long-term, profitable international accessories brand that couples contemporary Scandi-cool minimalism and authentic Italian craftsmanship. Our shoes and bags are designed in Stockholm and made by hand in Tuscany by a few carefully selected factories.
 



  
 



 ATP Atelier is a love child of a lifestyle between Italy and Sweden. It’s an obsession with quality leather, details and hard work. But it’s also about everyday life and the little things that make the biggest difference.
 



  





  





**About the role** 



* Reports to Retail Manager
* Part of the Retail Sales Team
* Part-time initially starting May 2025, with the potential to transition to full-time summer employment by mid-June to the end of August.
* The position is based in our location in Stockholm; at our new Flagship Store located on Jakobsbergsgatan 6, Stockholm.
* In this role you will be responsible for retail sales and delivering an elevated customer experience. You will also work closely with our E-commerce team and manage e-com orders, returns, customer service, stock taking and product claims. A genuine passion for sales, service, and administration is essential for success in this role.



  





**Tasks** 




  





 RETAIL SALES
 



 - Care for and build strong relationships with our customers in the Flagship store
 



 - Perform retail sales focusing on the customers’ needs while maximising sales
 



 - Keep the Flagship store and the back-office spaces tidy at all times
 



 - Administrating daily reports on sales
 



  





 CUSTOMER SERVICE
 



 - Deliver high-standard customer support and answer questions on our products and order specifics
 



 - Manage and administrate customer claims, questions and errands
 



  





 E-COM
 



 - Pick & pack and administrate online orders and returns
 



 - Help execute stock takings, deliveries & transfers
 



  
 



  





**We are looking for...** 



* Someone with outstanding interpersonal skills, outgoing, positive, and able to build amazing long-lasting relationships and understand the customer’s needs
* Someone who can provide impeccable service to our customers
* A very well-organised and structured person who can navigate the different tasks and understand those to prioritise and those to plan ahead
* A team player with a desire to collaborate and thinks work culture is important
* Someone who is solution-oriented and not afraid of challenges
* A great communicator both written and oral in Swedish and English
* Someone ambitious, driven and who has no problem taking own initiatives
* Someone who is flexible and enjoys fast-paced and dynamic workspace that can change day by day
* Someone available 5-10 hours per week, mostly on weekends, with extra flexibility during holidays. Available full-time during the summer season.



  
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Previous experience in retail or customer service roles
* Excellent written and oral English and Swedish communication skills
* Strong organisational skills with keen attention to detail
* Ability to problem-solve and adapt in a fast-paced setting
* Team player with a focus on fostering a positive workplace environment
* Experience with Microsoft packages is appreciated



  
 



  





 Apply by sending your CV and cover letter to shop@atpatelier.com with the subject “Part-Time Sales Advisor”.

title: Security Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery, we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a cloud security engineer, you will drive automation and integrate DevSecOps into our cloud-based platform by embedding security in CI/CD pipelines, enhancing infrastructure security and ensuring secure software development practices.
   

  

**As a Security Engineer, You Will**
* Coordinate penetration testing efforts and track remediations.
* Conduct threat modelling sessions, secure code review and vulnerability assessments.
* Develop and enforce cloud and infrastructure as code (IaC) security policies.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure security best practices and secure software development life cycle SSDLC (Shift-Left).
* Improve cloud security monitoring by building and managing detections.


**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Believing in collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleague, you will serve as the first point of contact for our Platform teams as a Cloud Security Subject Matter Expert to enable the delivery of great products.
   

  

**As a Security Engineer, You Have**
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results.
* Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to understand and implement security requirements in cloud environments
* Experience with security best practices and vulnerability management process
* Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (Security Command Centre, GKE, IAM), infrastructure as code (Terraform) and Github
* Familiarity with programming and major frameworks (Java Spring, React)
* Knowledge of SIEM solutions and ability to do log analysis


**What We Offer**
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as a security professional
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on:
 **career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering**
 Learn more about Nordnet in our brand movie
 **This is Nordnet** 
 , that describes our identity.
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Keri Bergström Käll at keri.bergstrom.kall@nordnet.com
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Spännande karriärmöjlighet som IT-tekniker!
description:
Vill du vara med och driva den digitala transformationen på ett företag inom fastighetsbranschen? Här får du chansen att utveckla verksamheten och bidra med dina kunskaper på en arbetsplats som präglas av stark teamkänsla och ny teknik.
   

  

 Uppdragsbeskrivning och huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ge IT-support avseende klienter och applikationer
* Administrera och utföra beställningar, avrop och behörigheter från verksamheten
* Säkerställa att inkommande IT-ärenden hanteras effektivt och inom SLA
* Handlägga ärenden via olika kanaler: ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och besök (On Site)
* Erbjuda telefonsupport för incidenter inkl. fjärrstyrning av klienter
* Felsöka och avhjälpa fel på arbetsplatser och mötesrum/konferensrum


 Erfarenheter, färdigheter och kunskaper:
   

  

 För uppdraget krävs minst 1 års erfarenhet av IT-support/IT-förvaltning. Har du kurser, eller eftergymnasial utbildning inom datavetenskap, IT eller relaterat område som IT-nätverk, IT-drift, IT-Infra och/eller certifieringar inom ITIL-certifiering, Microsoft AZ900, Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) eller liknande är det meriterande. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

* God kunskap om: Windows (WIN11), Microsoft 365, ITSM-verktyg, Intune, fjärråtkomstteknologier, Microsoft Active Directory/Azure AD, Citrix, printer felsökning, Outlook-klient, Office-paketet, Sharepoint/Teams, OneDrive
* Meriterande kunskap om: IT-säkerhet, IT-nätverk, scripting, WIN11 Arm, Microsoft Identity Manager (MIM)


 Vi söker en person som är serviceinriktad och kommunikativ med förmåga att hjälpa och kommunicera pedagogiskt med olika användare. Du bör vara lösningsorienterad med hög förmåga att felsöka och lösa problem, samt driven, ansvarstagande och självgående. God samarbetsförmåga är ett måste, liksom att vara strukturerad och van att jobba processorienterat. Dokumentationsvana i ärendehanteringssystem samt stresstålighet och erfarenhet av att hantera många uppgifter samtidigt är också viktiga egenskaper.

title: DevOps Engineers to ALTEN Sweden!
description:
Are you an
 **experienced DevOps engineer** 
 who wants to be a part of building the new organization within ALTEN Software Automotive? Join us at ALTEN in Stockholm and work with cutting-edge technologies to create a sustainable future together with our clients, and get the opportunity to work with world leading companies within the Automotive Industry.
 



  





*Does this sound interesting? Apply today!* 




  





  





**What we offer you** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We meet future challenges by supporting our clients’ projects and enabling our people to reach their full potential. We do so by offering technological challenges, fulfilling opportunities, inspiring togetherness and the possibility to contribute to a sustainable future.
 



  





  





**Who are you?** 




 To be a good match for the role we see that you hold at least 3 years of experience of DevOps. Besides from being passionate about DevOps, we think you are communicative, responsive and collaborative. We also think our new colleague has experienced in:
 



 • Python
 



 • GoLang or Bash
 



 • AWS
 



 • CI/CD
 



 • Docker or Kubernetes
 



 • Git or Jenkins
 



 Meritorious if you have:
 



 • Work experience in agile environments
 



 • Swedish language skills
 



  









  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Vi letar efter nätverkstekniker med stort intresse för automation till vår enhet Drift & Infrastruktur!
   

  

 Om du, precis som vi, tycker att det är kul att jobba med teknik som ligger i framkant, möjlighet att arbeta innovativt och ha stort inflytande i vägen framåt för nätverkstekniken du arbetar med så är vårt nätverksteam rätt ställe för dig!
   

  

 Vi har dessutom en bredd i vår arbetsvardag som ger oss möjligheter att både lära oss mer och jobba med en stor variation av uppgifter, samtidigt som vi kan fördjupa oss i områden vi tycker är extra spännande.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Hos oss kommer du ha en uppsjö av möjligheter att förändra och förbättra vårt tekniska område tillsammans med övriga i teamet. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att vara:
   

  

* utforska och implementera automationsidéer för vårt område (Tänk ”Infrastruktur som kod”)
* upprätthålla och utveckla vår befintliga IT-infrastruktur
* nätsäkerhet
* vara en idéskapare och problemlösare
* ha en positiv inställning och en förmåga att hålla humöret uppe även vid tekniska utmaningar
* sist men inte minst ha en stor portion humor, det ska vara kul på jobbet!


 Som nätverkstekniker hos oss kommer du att vara del i vårt nätverksteam som består av kompetenta kollegor som har roligt tillsammans. Vi arbetar agilt med stöd av ramverket SAFe där vi ständigt jobbar för att bli bättre oavsett vad det gäller med en öppen och positiv kultur.
   

  

 I vår agila organisation kommer du tillhöra tåget Tvärbanan, medans i vår linjeorganisation tillhör du området Infrastruktur där jag, Fredrik, kommer bli din chef och jag ser verkligen framemot att få med dig ombord på vår spännande resa framåt.
   

  

 Är du redo att kombinera din tekniska skicklighet med en dos humor och vara en del av ett team som tror att arbetsglädje är nyckeln till framgång, då är du den vi söker. Skicka in din ansökan idag och låt oss växa tillsammans!
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att trivas i rollen som nätverkstekniker hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har en god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och prestationsorienterad. Att arbeta som ett team är för dig en självklarhet, du har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med vårt klimat där kompetensspridning är en naturlig del i arbetet.
   

  

 För att nå våra mål har vi stort fokus på vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår arbetsplats. Du bör därför ha ett intresse och vilja att vara med på denna kulturresa. Vi arbetar aktivt med vårt medarbetarskap som omfattar alla på myndigheten och består av tre nyckelområden. Vi tar ansvar, möjliggör förändring och driver utveckling.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* Minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet inom några av följande nätverksområden: switching, routing, lastbalansering, WLAN, brandväggar och fysisk hårdvara för kontorsnätverk
* Relevant utbildning/kunskap eller arbetslivserfarenhet av teknisk systemutveckling inom till exempel Python och Ansible samt versionshantering med till exempel Git
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Atlassians produktsvit (Jira, Bitbucket/Git, Confluence)
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger centralt i Hornstull nära tunnelbanan.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan placeras i Stockholm eller Luleå som är IT-avdelningens kärnorter. Arbetet kommer innebära resor till våra kontor ute i hela landet. I Luleå sitter vi i helt nybyggda lokaler på Porsön vid Science Park i anslutning till universitetet. Vårt kontor i Stockholm är i nära anslutning till Hornstulls tunnelbana.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder. Vi gör pensioner enklare.
   

  

 #VårtJobbBerörAlla
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-31 | Kontakt: Fredrik Tideman 072-2102505, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Katarina Safar Leinikka, ST 101-4543587, | Publicerat: 2025-03-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-06

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer at Haypp, you'll collaborate with various departments and colleagues on diverse tasks. Your main goal is to maintain, configure, ensure compliance, and secure our services, systems, and endpoints. You'll also lead internal IT projects beyond daily team tasks.
   

  

 In addition, you will be responsible for monitoring and optimizing the performance of cloud-based systems, identifying potential security vulnerabilities, and implementing robust solutions to protect data integrity. You will work closely with network engineers, software developers, and system administrators to integrate new technologies and streamline workflows. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to rapidly changing environments are essential for success in this role.
   

  

 Moreover, you will oversee the deployment and management of cloud infrastructure, ensuring optimal scalability and reliability. You will conduct regular audits to assess the efficiency and security of our systems, troubleshoot complex issues that arise, and develop comprehensive documentation for processes and procedures. You will stay updated on the latest technologies and industry trends to continuously improve our processes and systems. Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing issues will help you thrive in this dynamic position.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design and implement secure, scalable, and reliable cloud infrastructure on Azure and AWS, including network configurations.
* Manage and configure Cloudflare settings for optimal security, performance, and network traffic management.
* Develop and maintain infrastructure as code using Bicep, with a focus on network resources like virtual networks, subnets, and network security groups.
* Utilize Git for version control and collaboration with team members on network-related infrastructure projects.
* Monitor network performance, troubleshoot network issues, and ensure high availability and performance of the cloud environment.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure network configurations align with application needs and deployment workflows.
* Stay current with the latest Azure, AWS and Cloudflare features and best practices to continuously improve the network infrastructure.


**What We Want From You**
* Strong experience with cloud infrastructure technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
* Proven experience with Azure networking services and Cloudflare's network solutions.
* Strong understanding of infrastructure as code, specifically with Bicep for infrastructure resource management and using Git for source control management.
* Knowledge of cloud networking best practices, security standards, and protocols.
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent work experience in network engineering.
* Relevant certifications in Azure networking and Cloudflare are a plus.
* Ability to work 100% on-site or hybrid remote with a minimum of 3 days/week in the Stockholm office.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiters Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com or Ani Lulja at ani.lulja@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Audio Visual Technician
description:
Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future ready, sustainable businesses. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world. For additional information, visit us at www.wipro.com
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 The Onsite & Dispatch Support team plays a key role in providing exceptional first-level support for client’s diverse technical environment. While the primary focus is on digital-first support, occasional onsite presence at client locations worldwide is required. The team ensures quick resolutions to IT service issues, supporting both resident and dispatch technicians who manage incident tickets and offer in-person assistance.
 



  





**Quantum Support Services** 




  





**What you need to have:** 




  




* Resident Technicians: 4+ years of experience; expertise in AV systems, hardware support, and network troubleshooting.
* Dispatch Technicians: 2+ years of experience; capable of troubleshooting diverse technical issues across locations.
* Experience with troubleshooting and managing AV systems (Crestron, Extron, Teams Rooms).
* Strong understanding of quantum computing and research environments.
* Proficient in hardware and peripheral management.
* Ability to coordinate and troubleshoot within a research setting.
* Quantum Support: Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM (local time) at research hubs.



  





**What you will do:** 




  




* We have to work during local business hours of that specific location. Expertise on local language with English written and communication expertise
* Strong communication skills, with a customer-focused approach to resolving issues.
* Ability to adapt to evolving environments, displaying flexibility and innovation in service delivery.
* Provide first-level onsite support for hardware, AV systems, device management, and basic networking.
* Act as the primary point of contact for onsite support, including issue registration, classification, and restoration of failed IT services.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless ticket dispatch and support across various service areas.
* Exhibit superior customer service by effectively communicating and assisting clients, while promoting a positive user experience.
* Manage and troubleshoot Microsoft devices, AV setups (Extron, Crestron), and conference room equipment, ensuring functionality during events.
* Contribute to AV event support, assisting with setup, troubleshooting, and post-event shutdown.
* Maintain inventory of devices, spare parts, and equipment, ensuring timely replacements and repairs.
* Certifications: CompTIA A+, CTS (Certified Technology Specialist), Azure Fundamentals, or equivalent.



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Provide onsite support at client research hubs (5 global locations).
* Offer support 4 hours per week during local business hours at each site.
* Manage peripheral stock (mice, keyboards, monitors) for the research hubs.
* Ensure availability of peripheral stock through business administrators.



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 




  





 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, sexual and political orientation and disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Equal IT is hiring an Engineer to help Build, Optimize, and Automate transactions with high security.
 



  





 This will be the first Engineer hired into a team built to focus on creating developer-friendly tools that accelerate the product lifecycle while ensuring smooth scalability.
 



  





 With a modern tech stack, a cloud-first approach, and a commitment to automation, the company are creating seamless payment experiences that power thousands of businesses.
 



  





 This role blends infrastructure, DevOps, and automation, with a strong emphasis on enabling engineering teams to move faster, deploy more reliably, and optimize their workflows.
 



  





 The Platform Engineering mission is to support and enable teams to deliver scalable, secure, and reliable software products efficiently by providing a standardized development platform, tooling, and infrastructure services by helping product-engineering teams to become self-sufficient in building products efficiently, reliably, and securely.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Work closely with developers to improve infrastructure, troubleshoot issues, and optimize deployment processes.
* Enhance platform tooling and automation, reducing bottlenecks and ensuring smooth CI/CD workflows.
* Champion DevOps and IaC best practices to improve efficiency and maintainability.
* Ensure system reliability through proactive monitoring, alerting, and incident response.
* Optimize cloud infrastructure to improve performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.
* Develop self-service automation solutions that empower teams to move faster with fewer roadblocks.
* Apply SRE principles to build stable and scalable systems



  





**Must-Have Skills** 



* Hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider (Ideally GCP)
* Strong DevOps background in CI/CD, IaC, Scripting and Automation
* Experience with Monitoring and Logging tools
* Experience with Docker and cloud-native orchestration
* Ability to troubleshoot infrastructure issues, optimize performance, and improve system reliability
* Experience with incident management and a proactive approach to minimizing downtime.



  





**Why Join Us?**
